citation.article-title: Maritalea myrionectae gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a culture of the marine ciliate Myrionecta rubra.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Maritalea (Ma.ri.ta′le.a. L. neut. n. mare the sea; L. fem. n. talea a staff, rod; N.L. fem. n. Maritalea rod inhabiting marine environments).
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Major polar lipids are PG, DPG, two unidentified glycolipids, an unidentified phospholipid and an unidentified lipid.
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Hyphomicrobiaceae.
The type species is Maritalea myrionectae.
